00604 #define EXP_OP_STATIC     0x00  
00605 #define EXP_OP_SIG        0x01  
00606 #define EXP_OP_XOR        0x02  
00607 #define EXP_OP_MULTIPLY   0x03

00641 #define EXP_OP_EXPAND     0x25

00644 #define EXP_OP_NEDGE      0x28

00646 #define EXP_OP_LAST       0x2a  
00647 #define EXP_OP_EOR        0x2b  
00648 #define EXP_OP_DELAY      0x2c  
00649 #define EXP_OP_CASE       0x2d  
00650 #define EXP_OP_CASEX      0x2e  
00651 #define EXP_OP_CASEZ      0x2f  
00652 #define EXP_OP_DEFAULT    0x30  
00653 #define EXP_OP_LIST       0x31  
00654 #define EXP_OP_PARAM      0x32  
00655 #define EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT 0x33  
00656 #define EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT 0x34  
00663 #define EXPR_IS_MEASURABLE(x)      (((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_STATIC) && \
00664                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_LAST) && \
00665                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_LIST) && \
00666                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_COND_SEL) && \
00667                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASE) && \
00668                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASEX) && \
00669                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASEZ) && \
00670                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_DEFAULT) && \
00671                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM) && \
00672                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT) && \
00673                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT) && \
00674                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_DELAY) && \
00675                                      !((SUPPL_IS_ROOT( x->suppl ) == 0) && \
00676                                        ((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_SIG) || \
00677                                         (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_SBIT_SEL) || \
00678                                         (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_MBIT_SEL)) && \
00679                                        (SUPPL_OP( x->parent->expr->suppl ) != EXP_OP_COND))) ? 1 : 0)
00680 
00685 #define EXPR_IS_STATIC(x)        ((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_STATIC)     || \
00686                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM)      || \
00687                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT) || \
00688                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT))
00689 
00694 #define EXPR_COMB_MISSED(x)        (EXPR_IS_MEASURABLE( x ) & \
00695                                     ~expression_is_static_only( x ) & \
00696                                     (~SUPPL_WAS_TRUE( x->suppl ) | ~SUPPL_WAS_FALSE( x->suppl )))

01158  $Log$
01159  Revision 1.65  2003/02/07 23:12:30  phase1geo
01160  Optimizing db_add_statement function to avoid memory errors.  Adding check
01161  for -i option to avoid user error.
01162 
01163  Revision 1.64  2003/01/04 09:25:15  phase1geo
01164  Fixing file search algorithm to fix bug where unexpected module that was
01165  ignored cannot be found.  Added instance7.v diagnostic to verify appropriate
01166  handling of this problem.  Added tree.c and tree.h and removed define_t
01167  structure in lexer.
01168 
01169  Revision 1.63  2003/01/03 05:52:01  phase1geo
01170  Adding code to help safeguard from segmentation faults due to array overflow
01171  in VCD parser and symtable.  Reorganized code for symtable symbol lookup and
01172  value assignment.
01173 
01174  Revision 1.62  2002/12/07 17:46:52  phase1geo
01175  Fixing bug with handling memory declarations.  Added diagnostic to verify
01176  that memory declarations are handled properly.  Fixed bug with infinite
01177  looping in statement_connect function and optimized this part of the score
01178  command.  Added diagnostic to verify this fix (always9.v).  Fixed bug in
01179  report command with ordering of lines and combinational logic verbose output.
01180  This is now fixed correctly.
01181 
01182  Revision 1.61  2002/12/06 02:18:59  phase1geo
01183  Fixing bug with calculating list and concatenation lengths when MBIT_SEL
01184  expressions were included.  Also modified file parsing algorithm to be
01185  smarter when searching files for modules.  This change makes the parsing
01186  algorithm much more optimized and fixes the bug specified in our bug list.
01187  Added diagnostic to verify fix for first bug.
01188 
01189  Revision 1.60  2002/11/27 03:49:20  phase1geo
01190  Fixing bugs in score and report commands for regression.  Finally fixed
01191  static expression calculation to yield proper coverage results for constant
01192  expressions.  Updated regression suite and development documentation for
01193  changes.
01194 
01195  Revision 1.59  2002/11/24 14:38:12  phase1geo
01196  Updating more regression CDD files for bug fixes.  Fixing bugs where combinational
01197  expressions were counted more than once.  Adding new diagnostics to regression
01198  suite.
01199 
01200  Revision 1.58  2002/11/23 21:27:25  phase1geo

01205  (this is a brainstorm on how to handle FSMs when we get to this point).  Fixed
01206  bug with code underlining function in handling parameter in reports.  Fixing bugs
01207  with MBIT/SBIT handling (this is not verified to be completely correct yet).
01208 
01209  Revision 1.56  2002/11/05 00:20:06  phase1geo

01211  output in report command and updating full regression.
01212

01214  Fixing C compatibility problems with cc and gcc.  Found a few possible problems
01215  with 64-bit vs. 32-bit compilation of the tool.  Fixed bug in parser that
01216  lead to bus errors.  Ran full regression in 64-bit mode without error.
01217 
01218  Revision 1.54  2002/10/29 19:57:50  phase1geo
01219  Fixing problems with beginning block comments within comments which are
01220  produced automatically by CVS.  Should fix warning messages from compiler.
01221 
01222  Revision 1.53  2002/10/25 13:43:49  phase1geo
01223  Adding statement iterators for moving in both directions in a list with a single
01224  pointer (two-way).  This allows us to reverse statement lists without additional
01225  memory and time (very efficient).  Full regression passes and TODO list items
01226  2 and 3 are completed.
